We were lucky enough to be there the first day Chisme offered homemade sangria and we were happy to partake. :) It was tasty without being overly sweet but a couple diners in our party thought it was a little light on the wine. 

The staff was very friendly and attentive. I would give them 5 stars but I do think the price is just a little high for what you get. It was definitely delicious and worth trying!
author: Kelly T.

description: Mexican with a new touch. I took tacos with aubergine and was really good. Kind and quick. I definitely recommend it.
author: Andrea C.

description: I was very happy to have some new Mexican food in the neighborhood. Its a little pricey but it is delicious. The Jackfruit tacos are yum.
author: Sarah P.

description: Best vegan tacos in the Bay Area. Get the Jackfruit or Via Via yum. Also a lot of the staff is Latinx, very important. Support this friendly, delicious establishment.
author: Dom R.

description: Holy moly - walking home during YAHW (yet another heat wave) and a gal was outside handing out menus. SUCH. A cute spot, great ambiance. Foo was delicious. A friend and I split the began plantain tacos and the skirt steak with peanut molé. ZOMG. We'll be back!!
author: Arianna P.

description:
Tacos executed to perfection! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. We were a group of 5 and ordered all the tacos on the menu and were blown away by the flavors on each and every one of them. The jackfruit taco stood out among the vegetarian tacos. 

Must try and will come back again.
author: Vinay P.

description:
Don't you hate it when you're traveling somewhere, randomly just decide to stop in a place to grab a quick bite, and then have something so amazing that you're having craving for it when you don't live anywhere close to the place?That's what happened to me with Chisme's Jackfruit tacos. 

This place is so cute. I love the artist Fnch so I was happy to find his little honey bears lined up like they were meeting me for lunch. My boyfriend and I split the Via Via and the Jackfruit tacos. If you are two vegan eaters, order just like that. Eat the Jackfruit tacos first (I still cannot believe how good they were), and end with the sweet plantain. 

Only open for 5 weeks, this place is going to be around for awhile, they're food is just too good.
author: Jacklyn K.

description: Wow. Best vegan tacos I've ever had!! The jackfruit tacos are shredded/pulled and deep fried, oh my god :D crispy, savory, a little spicy, delicious! There are 2 other vegan taco options. I ordered takeout
author: Joe R.

description: I stopped in here when I was in town. The place is super cute and is decorated really nicely. I had no idea that it had just recently opened until the owner started chatting with me as I was in there eating - really awesome customer service! I had the chicken tacos and decided to treat myself to some churros since I noticed a few other people were also eating them. The food came out pretty quickly and the chicken tacos were super good, the presentation alone gets 5 stars because they looked too good to eat. The churros were even better, if that's possible. I truly don't think I've eaten such a delicious desert before, and that's not an exaggeration - everyone needs to order the churros!! The girls at the front were really nice and friendly, they answered any questions I had with no issues - which I appreciated. I'll be back for more tacos and definitely more churros if I'm ever back in town!! :)
author: Tara S.

description: One of the best tacos and great service. Jackfruit tacos and cauliflower ceviche is a must!! Value for money
author: Pratiksha S.

description: Ordered pulled chicken taco, looked great but awful Mexican food, tasteless ..had to add so much lemon and hot sauce to make it edible. Quesadilla was better compared to taco, but in general not good Mexican food being in SF (which has so many great options). Good ambeince and service, giving 2 stars for it.
author: Praniti S.

description: Great place for locals and tourists! Food was fresh with unique presentation. I will be back every time in San Francisco! Owner Ray is delightful and passionate about guest service.
author: Leslie L.

description: Yessss! Go here for the chicken tacos with peanut mole. Service was incredibly friendly and fast. Food was fresh and delicious. A bit pricey for street-style tacos, but that's to be expected in SF. Edible flower garnish was a fun touch. Everything has a generous dusting of cilantro, so if you're one of those rare unfortunates who find it soapy, request your order without it.
author: Rachel G.

description:
Where to start! Counter ordering so nice and casual. Food is amazing, customer service on point. 
Had jack fruit and fried plantain tacos, yummy!!
author: Chauntae M.

description:
First and foremost the people that have taken our orders have been amazing and this review does not reflect the service or staff whatsoever. 

I think the problem I have with Chisme is perhaps the efficiency of the kitchen, speed of food deliver(chips and guacamole came out 15 minutes after our order was placed , when our mains arrived on a slow Monday evening)/prices on our meals on both visits have been insanely high, for that money I Could have eaten at Liho Liho across the street or 2x visits to any of the rest of the neighborhood taco places. 

I understand Brick and mortar prices when starting out, I've been a member of the service industry for 20 years, cook,expo, server, bar back, bartender, barista etc. but for a very small steak quesadilla $12 dollars is pretty bad. I was very excited for vegan options for my girlfriend since the usual is a veggie burrito minus some toppings at other places so when she sampled 2 different tacos on 2 visits and was left unimpressed it bummed me out. Also there are a lot of fried options for the vegan choices. It would be nice to see the jackfruit made like carnitas or pulled chicken as opposed to deep fried. Over all it just feels like I'm dining at an off the grid style food truck inside of a great store front. I think part of the menu needs a reinvigoration instead of the usual suspects you might see at so many "hip" Mexican takes on classic styled restaurants. 

I make vegan Mexican food all the time at home, family recipes and new ideas. I'd love to see some classics made vegan instead of what we ordered. We live in the neighborhood and would love to love this place, but $40 for one order of tacos, a quesadilla, 12 chips in a pile of guacamole and a horchata(fantastic) is not worth coming back unless some things change. It's sit down prices at a fast casual place. 

I would love to have my mind  changed but I think portion control, prices, and menu revamp would be needed.
author: Joe A.

description:
We went, we ate , we drank.  6 girls, 6 orders of tacos, 5 beers, 3 sides   Fantastic flavors. Beautiful presentation.  Nice atmosphere. Very helpful and friendly service. Authentic mole. The menu has lots of items for all the meat eating folks and lots of items for vegan folks. 
My favorites were the shrimp and plantain tacos, the poblano mash potatoes and some of the best guacamole I have had.
author: Catherine S.

description: Amazing food! Guacamole was delish! We had the chicken taco and the vegan/vegetarian taco which honestly was my fave and I'm not even a vegetarian.: coconut horchata.. fantastic! Great service and ambiance... just what the neighborhood needed!
author: Maggie G.

description: With quite high expectations after i've read other Yelp-reviews I thought this taco would be increible so to say, but I was wrong. The taco was OK, but not more than that. I think you can find loads of tastier taco in town!
author: Frida Ö.

description: Cute decor and AMAZING tacos and food!!! The skirt steak taco was the bomb. You also have to try the PINCHElotes and the guac with pomegranate! So funny, so good!
author: Robyn A.

description: So many vegan options that taste amazing (and I'm not vegan)! Really loved everything we had and will definitely be back to try the rest. Really loved the jack fruit tacos
author: Lee P.

description: Ordered a large variety of different tacos and literally every single one was incredible. The staff is super nice and welcoming from the moment you walk in, great staff and amazing food.
author: Christopher K.

description: This is the coolest new spot in our neighborhood! We are so excited to have a yummy, fun and vibrant  spot. All the food is on point!
author: Mariela C.

description: A top-notch taco joint and a great addition to the SF Mexican scene. Solid, creative take with some playful choices like the jackfruit taco. I've probably tried most of their tacos over a few visits - love everyone of them!
author: Srikanth N.

description: Loved going into this vibrant and friendly place for lunch during work! Strange I know but the mashed potatoes are a MUST share. I always get the shrimp tacos it's perfectly seasoned and has a nice kick. I'm usually not into horchata but damn it's good here.
author: Sonya S.

description: This food is OK and completely overpriced. The beef tacos were super duper greasy. To the point it was dripping out of the taco. I couldn't believe how greasy they were. The last time I ordered the same tacos and they were cold. I thought maybe it was me cause I didn't eat fast enough. But no. Second time tacos we're barely warm. I am disappointed. Should have went somewhere else. Or maybe ordered something besides the steak skirt tacos.
author: Andrea N.

description: Absolutely amazing place! Walked in and it was roomy and had plenty of seating. The sweet ladies at the counter had the best customer service and the kindest smiles (two things that I appreciate immensely!). The plantain tacos were insane. Mango salsa was fresh. My husband had the skirt steak tacos and loved them! Great choices for vegans and carnivores alike. What a gem!
author: Christeen M.

description:
I was so excited to discover this new restaurant! The half mile walk from work was totally worth it. The jackfruit tacos are AMAZING! Great flavor, texture & spice.
I will be back to try the multiple vegan options on their menu. Yum!
author: Eva P.

description:
Sooooo good!! Staff gets an A+++ !!! Nicest girls ever who really care and take pride in their work. Going above and beyond to make sure everyone is taken care of! The tacos may have taken 5-10 extra minutes than normal but well worth the wait! They were super busy too so it made sense. At least the staff was super friendly and attentive... which made the wait not bad at all. 
We got the steak and chicken tacos.. A! 
(I would like two tortillas per taco) but I kno most "city ppl" would hate that  
Overall great experience and trendy decorations! Super cute touch putting pretty pansies on the tacos(keeping it unique and classy) 
AND don't let me forget the CHURROS!!!! To dieeeee for. Oh my goodness. They are the best we have EVER had. Def a must have. Will forsure be back here shortly
author: Haley J.

description: I was very excited to try this place as I have passed it everyday since it opened. It did not disappoint! I got the Steak Taco's and Mashed Potatoes. The tacos were very flavorful and reminded me of being on the streets in Mexico. And the Mashed Potato creation was unique and yummy with layers of flavor. Can't wait to bring my friends to try this new SF Hit!
author: Kyle N.

description:
Oh man oh man!!!! Food was fantastic!!! I had two tacos, the via via and the skirt steak and both very wonderful. 

The via via was this sweet, creamy, and ever so slightly spicy taco. HIT THE SPOT! The mango pico is what is up with the world.

The skirt steak was fresh, juicy, and perfectly marinated.

Pinchelotes (corn) was also really great.

HAPPY BELLY.

Great beer selection and atmosphere. Super happy I stopped in here.
author: Ann M.

description:
The tacos are nutritious, delicious and filling! Two orders and a side and you're good for a date night meal. The ingredients are fresh, the food is quick and perfectly cooked. The mahi mahi tacos were the best, hands down. 

Ordering the cauliflower ceviche, it was good (don't get me wrong) but the ingredients were simple and the idea of paying almost $10 for a bowl of raw cauliflower and spices was a little reality kick in the ass that you're paying San Francisco prices. 

Great place though, they should be getting sangria and wine soon.
author: Cabaca T.

description: Was in town for a few days and was looking for a good place to eat. Since it was Taco Tuesday we decided to try this place out. I did not think I would find a place that could match the quality of tacos at some of the places back home in Phoenix. Boy was I wrong! I had the steak tacos and my wife had the shrimp. Both were fantastic! My son had the quesadilla and he loved it. We also shared the pinchelotes which were probably my favorite.The cashier who may have been the owner was very nice as well. Would come back if I ever am in the area again!
author: Michael K.

description:
I came here with a group of vegetarians and we ordered the following

- mahi mahi tacos (for me the only non veg person): 3.5/5

- plantain tacos: 2/5 not enough flavor. Flavors didn't make sense together. I've had delicious plantain tacos with black beans, cilantro and hot sauce. These just didn't land.

- eggplant tacos: 3/5 the fried eggplant was good, tacos were again seriously lacking in flavor (and salt)

- cauliflower ceviche: 1/5 this item is 99% branding. It's literally raw riced cauliflower in lime juice. Not good.

- death via ginger: 2/5 way too sweet to be "medicinal" as claimed on the menu

I had really high hopes for this place, but the food was not good and the service was also a 2/5. Would not reccommend.
author: Somya M.

description:
Tacos are phenom but look out for the yellow sauce that comes with them, it's so spicy that I almost threw up haha. (I hate spicy food.) 

The mashed potatoes are an absolute most-order. They're not good for you but they're so delicious that I've gone back twice for them.
author: Anthony J.

description: Great tacos. Really good vegi options. Awesome service. Fast. Good beer. All round winner.
author: Joshua M.

description: I want to really like this place. But it was a three star experience. I like the decor, the staff seemed friendly, I believe I met the owner and she seemed interesting, and most importantly, I loved the concept of the menu...but, I felt a little let down by the "casual cantina" it represents itself as. The menu is priced for a minimum of $20 per person to have a meal. It is hard to walk out of there satisfied for less. The most filling item is a $12 quesadilla, but I still wanted more. And it took almost 20 minutes to get. Great place to eat, have drinks and share a meal with friends. Not so great for stopping in for a quick reasonably priced meal.  But all the cute plates did look yummy. Quesadilla was tasty, but not $12 tasty. The safest part is that I'm a taco fiend. I LOVE tacos. But I would've had to have spent $20 to be satisfied with a taco meal there. You get two tacos for $12, basically forcing you into ordering more. The tacos options looked really good.
author: Matt S.

description: Good food not great, just a bit overpriced. I paid $5 for a Coconut Milk Horchata which was okay nothing amazing it came in like a 12 ounce plastic cup, and I was not offered a free refill:( .... The tacos I ordered were really good though, I got the plantain black bean veggie tacos and they were a 9 out of ten.  The Cauliflower Ceviche was good, it had a coconut flavor, tastes tropical I would rate the Ceviche a 6 out of ten. The food is good, the taco shop order at the counter concept combined with the prices could use some work....
author: Angel F.

description: AMAZINGGGGGG. Best tacos I've ever had. Go try this awesome place! House drinks are bomb too :)
author: Angelica W.

description: This place is great! Went last Friday and ordered the shrimp tacos, which were delicious. My BF orders the steak and couldn't say enough good things about them also. We would definite go back!
author: Ashley N.

description: Hot girls work here. And they are so sweet too. And the food is AMAZING. And the vibe is amazing. I love this place and can't wait to come back!
author: CeeCee Y.

description: I love this place. It's cute on the inside and the food is really solid. They have great vegetarian and vegan options. The only thing is I wish their fried vegetarian options were also gluten free. I'm dying to try the jackfruit tacos, but I will die if I do. Can't have it all, I guess. Be sure to try the mashed potatoes. And the guac is next level.
author: Sarah D.

description:
A friend of mine posted a picture of her tacos with the flower on it and that's really why I even came Chisme, what can i say i love those instagram aesthetics~~~ 

I figured Chisme would be another what I call "gringo" cantina, but to my surprise it was far from basic. I had the "Chicken Demi Da" minus the onions. 6/5 would highly recommend!
author: Viviana M.

description: This review is for the vegan options. The jackfruit taco was outstanding. Deep-fried (?) jackfruit gave it a crispiness I've never seen before. The texture worked really well. The eggplant was interesting, but I probably won't order it again. I didn't love the other vegan one (black beans and plantains) because it tasted like a Caribbean plate in taco form, which is to say, it was tasty but not what I want in a taco. I didn't love the horchata but my bf loved it. It tasted like coconut milk with cinnamon... which again, is fine, but not what I want when i order horchata. (The coconut ranch also tasted very strongly of coconut, didn't love that.) I wish you could order one taco instead of two, but I think that would draw more attention to the ridiculous price per taco. But it's a fancy taco and a tasty taco, so I'll pay the extra for that jackfruit. Anyway, the staff was friendly, the green hot sauce was delicious, and the jackfruit taco was so good.
author: Megan S.

description: The food here is good but not as down and dirty the way I like Mexican food to be as the food is more refined. The wait staff are very friendly and kind and that goes a long way.
author: N A.

description: This place is hot! Cute new little place in the tendernob. Love the ambience and the food here is banging! Yummy tacos and everything is presented so nicely. And a great selection of beer and sangria.
author: Bernadette B.

description: I cannot get enough of this place.  It's dangerously close to my apartment and I've started limiting myself to once a week here.  If not, I'd end up living here. I have yet to order something that wasn't amazing.  From atmosphere, employees, to plating and TASTE- this place is legit. My favorite are the shrimp or mahi tacos and the churros- OMG!!!!
author: Aubany G.

description:
The jack fruit tacos were so good! I am craving for them right now!
such good food and friendly service!
author: Raja K.

description: Get the vegan, jack fruit tacos. Mouth watering delicious!! Nice decor. Friendly staff. A welcome addition to the Nob Hill Neighborhood.
author: Annmarie S.

description: Chisme is an outstanding addition to the neighborhood. The mahi mahi tacos are some of the best fish tacos money can buy and the shrimp tacos are no joke either. The churros are delicious and decadent. Fantastic beer selection from San Francisco's own Barebottle Brewery, and the people behind the counter are always friendly.
author: Troy H.

description: The tacos are fine, slightly upscale California style, not authentic Mexican. 4 tacos and 2 horchata for $40 is insane... just absolutely ridiculous. I've had way better for under $10. It was very late and I was desperate. There was nothing wrong with them except the price, but nothing special either. I really don't understand all the great reviews.
author: Nicole H.

description: This place has the absolute best tacos, quesadillas, and CHURROS in downtown SF. The steak quesadilla with plantains is insanely good, but it also has plenty of great vegetarian options. Love this place!
author: Zavier A.

description: Came here around dinner time with a group of friends. The tacos are all so flavorful and the chips are super fresh. The shrimp tacos are a MUST have. The service was amazing and the churros were perfect
author: Eric P.

description: Amazing first experience. Tried most of the tacos and each one did not disappoint. Varies flavors from each taco and very distinct too. The chips they had are freshly made by hand as well and very crisp. Their house sauce is lemony with a kick of spicy and goes very well with the chips. I'm not a dessert person but their caramel churros are to die for, and it came with whip cream. 10/10 would recommend.
author: Richard P.

description: This place will elevate your taste for tacos. Come here to explore new tastes on your palette. The service is amazing, and the decor on the food is superb, and the ambience is very casual. Will definitely be back!
author: Edward L.

description: AMAZING FOOD. I dream about it nightly (no exaggeration). The service was incredible, great atmosphere. If you're looking for a solid place for tacos and guacamole, you found it.
author: Leondra Y.

description:
This place is AMAZING! They just opened in lower nob hill a couple days ago and there's seriously nothing like this in SF! 

I was drawn in by the super cute Fnnch mural and decided to stop by on opening day to try out the tacos. They have 6 total on the menu and three of them are vegan friendly. Amazing. My favorite by far were the shrimp tacos. They're served on corn tortillas (the owner says they're from El Milagro in Chicago!) with huge sautéed shrimp, purple cabbage, the most delicious mango salsa, and a drizzle of their house peanut mole. 

The menu is super fresh and most items are vegan friendly which is a much needed addition to the San Fran taco scene. For the guac and chips they give you the option of adding in pomegranate or mango to it for a small extra charge. Do it. Totally worth it! 

From the delicious fairly-priced food, to the adorable interior, this place is definitely worth trying out!
author: Tori M.

description: This place is cute and good. When you walk in, it's easy to think it's just for a quick bite, but actually the food portions are hearty and it's cozy to sit at one of the tables. If you want a fast meal you can get that here, but it's also a good place to hang out for a while. It's comfortable whether you're dining solo or with a group. Steak tacos are yummy - the peanut mole is very flavorful. And they make really fresh, flavorful salsas here too. Lots of great beers on tap. Even though you order at the counter and then take a seat to wait for your food to be brought out, they are super nice here. Feel free to ask for more salsa or to try any of the beers before deciding what you want. They want you to enjoy what you order and come back again. And this formula works!
author: Sonya S.

description: GET THE STEAK QUESADILLA ! It was delicious, also the mole tacos are splendid loved it!
author: Rebecca F.

description: This is a great taco place. Its not your standard taco place, and thats one of the reasons I love it. The food is very fresh, and even more so, its definitely unique. There is a great atmosphere in the restaurant, its great for kids and groups.
author: Benin B.

description: I had their steak tacos today, and was blown away by both the quality of the beef and the size of the portion. They were twelve bucks for two, so I wanted to see if it was worth it, and it totally was. I'm very excited to have high quality food just a block away, a great addition to my neighborhood.
author: andrew f.

description: By now I've pretty much tried everything on the menu. Even though I am a carnivore I can say I still enjoyed  the vegan and vegetarian options. The Via Via and the Chicken Demi Da were my two favorites. It's nice too see that they have recently adjusted their prices! I'm still not sure why people are comparing this too a taco truck when clearly it's a taco building. I liked the atmosphere in the restaurant. I didn't feel rushed eating my food. Most of the restaurant was instagramable. The honey bears are a nice touch! I've had similar style tacos in Chicago so believe it or not thats a thing. I'll be back here soon.
author: Greg C.

description: Can't mix and match tacos. Tacos are pretty average, not mind blowing. Probably wouldn't come back here.
author: Tina J.

description: This is a great addition to the TenderNob/Lower Nob Hill neighborhood which has Yelp favorites such as Liholiho Yacht Club, Mr. Holmes Bakeshop, Mensho Tokyo and Elephant Sushi. It's Mexican fushion is a fresh alternative from your neighborhood tacqueria. It has vegan options as well for health conscious and guilt free eaters. The place is spacious and colorful, a great place to wind down at the end of the day.
author: Raymond V.

description: New place...super legit tacos...solid local microbrews on tap...friendly staff. New neighborhood staple
author: Brett N.

description: Being from San Diego, I've eaten a lot of tacos. These are without a doubt some of the best I've ever had. I literally eat here several times a week, and the friends I've brought here all feel the same. Not to mention the staff is awesome.
author: andrew c.

description: Cauliflower Ceviche was amazing. Excited to try more things on the menu. Cute atmosphere.
author: Dominique G.

description: Great addition to the neighborhood. Their tacos are damn good--I recommend the shrimp and vegan jackfruit tacos. Definitely coming back!
author: Laura U.

description: This place has the best tacos! We had the chicken and the jackfruit tacos. They were both delicious and full of flavor. I also had the death via ginger drink and it was amazing! So glad this is in our neighborhood. We'll definitely be back!
author: Ashley M.

description: Absolutely delicious! I always get the shrimp tacos, my husband gets the steak. Whatever sauce they use is absolutely incredible. Super tasty with a spicy kick. Get the churros for dessert! Customer service is superb. We'll be back a million more times.
author: Kayla N.

description: The shrimp tacos...mmmmmm...I was a bit hesitant to try this place since it's new and might need to work out service kinks. Beer was so reasonably priced and again, those shrimp tacos...
author: Sean W.

description:
High points: Ginger, lime, and mint tea.  Shrimp tacos.  Chips.  Hostess.  

Not-so-high points:  Too heavy handed on the mole sauce.  It is a good sauce, just too much of it.  This is the first mole that I actually liked, though.  So I got that going for me.

The guacamole is good, too, but I prefer mine with onion and tomato mixed in.  Chisme's guac is made fresh with avocado, cilantro, lime, and salt.  Simple, clean, and tasty, but I miss the onion and tomato.
author: Alex F.

description: I stopped in for a quick bite with a friend of mine on Halloween night. The two staff that were at the front of the store were genuinely kind and had no problem giving me recommendations. I am a vegetarianan and they had plenty of options for me. I tried a couple different tacos and I liked everything I had, but i highly recommend the jackfruit one!
author: Matthew H.

description: Excellent food and amazing staff. It's like a down played gourmet Mexican taqueria. The ambiamce is inviting and laid back but the food is high end. Good beer prices and they're open late too!
author: Tommy M.

description: I have been going to Chisme for about a month and I must say this place is great. Good food and hospitality are the essentials for me to come back to a restaurant and Chisme got it. Recommended to anyone who lives in the neighborhood to make it your go to spot.
author: Guled M.

description:
World class. Great food and great service. We went here twice during our 3 day stay. Both times everything was stellar. The second time, we ordered steak tacos but the girl that took the ordered accidentally put in chicken. When we pointed this out, she kindly said sorry and said she'll arrange steak, she did this without charging us the difference. Then, when the food arrived, we had not realized that one pair of the tacos has a peanut mole on it, and did not ask for it to be removed when we ordered. This was not a problem but the girl just left the peanut one and brought a second pair without peanuts to no extra charge. 

Just an example and it was this great overall. Go there.
author: Joel N.

description: My friend Emilie and I came in to Chisme, late night, the other day. We live in the neighborhood and have been waiting for somewhere like this to open up so close to home! Ray, the owner, was so welcoming and awesome! The customer service we received gets 5 stars alone. On top of that, everything we had was amazing as well. My favorite thing we had was a toss between the Pinchelote and Flower Basket!!! Need to go back asap for these bomb dishes!!!!
author: Ambz C.

description: Best Tacos in Nob Hill! Lots of options and delicious House-made habanero hot sauce. Definitely gonna be my regular spot.
author: Austin P.

description: Omg soooo good. This place is nice, clean , great food and great service. Keep it up.
author: Adam S.

description: This super cute place just opened around the corner from me and I've been 3 times in the past month. It's fast casual (but with a delicious beer and wine selection from Bare Bottle - try the Cascade IPA if they have it), affordable, and absolutely delicious (though I haven't strayed from the chips and guac and steak tacos since I legit crave them). Across from liholiho too as a yummy backup if you can't get in. Hope they stay in the neighborhood for a good long while!
author: Carolyn M.

description: This place is amazing! I'm from Austin where pretty much all Mexican food is the bomb, and this is the first place in SF that compares with its authenticity and interesting flavor combinations. I had the steak tacos which were phenomenal. One of the owners graciously offered to let my friends and I try some new menu items being worked on and I can promise that there are even more good things to come!
author: Allison O.

description: This place is amazing.  My husband and I are vegan and have tried nearly every vegan option in the Bay Area and Chisme's vegan entrees are the tastiest by far.  Their understanding and balance of flavors is very impressive!
author: Ares B.

description: Fantastic new taco spot with high quality ingredients and $5 beers. Make sure you try the churros, they're insane.
author: Grady J.

description: The most filling and tasty eggplant Tacos I've ever had. An amazing vegetarian option in a sunny Lower Nob Hill neighborhood. I was surprised, exclaiming "holy shit" to myself. A great addition that is sure to grow with everyone living here.
author: Mark C.

description: Delicious tacos, great guacamole, and solid sangria. The ambiance is chill, prices are reasonable for the quality of food you're getting, and an overall wonderful experience. Definitely recommend stopping by for some beer and tacos.
author: Aly M.

description: The tacos are really good and they have good beer on tap. You must get the churros and I'd recommend the guacamole as well. Really great spot for fast dinner.
author: Chris B.

description: Great find on Yelp. Right amount of spicy in the food and good local beer. Personable service and attention a plus.
author: Franklin W.

description: I tried Chisme out this past weekend. They have the best shrimp tacos and elote I've had in the city. The shrimp tacos come two per order, and I really appreciate the fact that they're sautéed rather than fried! I'll definitely be back!
author: Matt B.

description: THIS PLACE IS THE BEST!!!!!!!!!!!! The food is so bomb!!!! The tacos are garnished with flowers "QUE CUTE!!" You will absolutely loveeeeee ittt my favorite new place in SAN FRAN!!!! Please get the chicken demida and the corn! :-D
author: Vanessa H.

description:
We've had 3 of their tacos (chicken, jackfruit, and eggplant) and I thought they were all excellent! The mashed potato was the bomber (pbbly the best mash I've had) and the rice/beans side was also really good. 

My only 2 gripes:
At $4.5-$6 (including tax) for EACH taco, it's pricey for what you get. A portion of 2 is not filling. I wish they'd have an option to do 3 for $10.

Single-use cups, bowls, and utensils drive me crazy. I know the owner said that they recycle and not having to do dishes saves water. But take into account what it takes to produce/transport those paper plates and plastic water cups (which are not recyclable or compostable) = not so convinced. Super Duper uses corn-based compostable utensils so maybe that's a good compromise? Just my 2 cents. 

Regardless, great creative tacos and menu. Vegan friendly. And a great neighborhood addition.
author: Barney S.

description: Food is DELICIOUS!!!! It would be 5 stars if the staff was a bit more on-it. Great addition to the neighborhood. Really chill, order at the counter, grab a seat, enjoy a beer or sangria. The guac is BOMB, churros are out of this world, every taco I tried was super flavorful. Definitely adding this to one of my "regulars."
author: Colleen C.

description: Place had awesome food and delicious drinks.  The owner was super friendly and it was a great choice for some late night tacos.  Definitely would recommend coming here, their vegans tacos were super good despite me being a firm believer in eating delicious animals.
author: Ryan L.

description: Really enjoyed this place. Small manageable menu, and the owners will be taking care of you personally. One order of tacos comes with two 6-inch tacos, which is plenty. I went with a friend and we ordered two taco orders and shared. The steak and chicken were both delicious. You must order the churros!! They're amazing, never had better. Small drink selection (no margs, sad). But fantastic food.
author: Patrick s.

description: Great, deep, complex flavors in a tasty soft corn tortilla. Chips and quacamole are great additions. Highly recommend for a casual, quick dinner or reliable take-out option.
author: Adam K.

description: Came here for a quick , inexpensive dinner and was not disappointed. Everything was super fresh and delicious! Got the chicken tacos and the vegan plantain tacos and they were both so so good. Friendly service and attentive.
author: Amanda G.

description: Really delicious food and relaxed vibe. The jackfruit tacos were amazing. Honestly some of the best food I've had in SF. Would highly recommend.
author: Jimmy H.

description:
My wife and I were in San Francisco over the weekend and we stumbled upon here and grabbed some food. The decor is nice and modern and the ambiance is fast casual. The staff was friendly and attentive as well. The items I tried were the:

1) steak tacos: these were tasty and I felt had a fair amount of steak in them. I know other people complained about the amount, but I didn't have that issue. The steak was also tender and not overly salted (I hate salty food). The peanut mole was something I enjoyed, even though I was hesitant at first. 

2) mashed potato bowl: these were my favorite item. Poblanos in mashed potatoes are delicious! I'm surprised this isn't more common. 

3) black bean and mango: I liked this a lot as well. Black beans and mangos, what's not to like?  

My wife also had the via via taco. I didn't get a chance to try it, but she loved it. 

All in all, this was a positive experience for me and if I lived in the area I'd go back for sure since some of the other items I saw people eating looked good as well.
author: Sargon N.

description: The food was delicious. We had a beef and a chicken quesadilla, chips & salsa, and two beers for $41. Personally I would have preferred my food on a real plate with real cutlery, not paper and plastic. The place was nice, clean, and airy, with big windows overlooking the street. The service was nice and friendly, and the food arrived quickly.
author: Jan S.

description: Love the vegan tacos, jackfruit tacos are AMAZING churros are next level, love this place so glad it's close
author: Kels K.

description: Awesome service. Simple, but unique menu.  Passionate owner.  I highly recommend this restaurant. The atmosphere is laid back and fun.
author: Antonio R.

description: Delicious tacos and great atmosphere! Was in town for a few nights and well I love tacos! I'd consider myself a taco expert (only because I eat too many tacos), and I loved each one. I had the chicken, skirt steak and shrimp tacos and all were great. Friendly staff too!
author: Mo D.

description: It's rare I take the time to write a positive review, but my taste buds are extremely happy right now and I just left this restaurant so I wanted to share! We had a small group of one vegan, one vegetarian, and two meat eaters, and everybody felt they had a great meal. We sampled several appetizers and probably 6 of the 8 or so types of tacos on the menu. The beer was really good as well and the chips were awesome and fresh. Others have posted complaints about the price of the tacos but you have to understand that these are not bean and cheese tacos, they are very fresh and flavorful, and still in my opinion a very good value for the money. The service was warm and the space felt good to be in.
author: Sonoma L.

description: I'm going to agree with vivy's review the tacos are bland. We had the shrimp and the chicken. We were hoping the hot sauce would pep things up but instead that too was bland. The sides have ridiculously small portions even without how expensive they are. The service was bad as well. Really slow and if you ask for anything they will fill the straws or something else before they help you even though there are only 4 customers.
author: Ellen F.

description: Updated review to add one more star for owners kind response : Pretty good food, over priced of course for what it is. Awesome decor and wild use of color. No tipping option on their square tablet payment machine. I can't  figure out why in the most expensive city in the country one would not always have a tipping option at a restaurant is absurd and makes us guests feel like you don't care about your staff which in turn makes me.not want to support you in my neighborhood. Now don't be rude with weird amounts please....15% ,18%,20% is acceptable. You also have no happy hour pricing at all. I walk by every day and I see the place empty. Just a couple ideas to fix this before you go belly up and start blaming  the neighborhood. There are many in the direct neighborhood who don't have kitchens but I keep walking by every day because of these few easy fixes. A frequent diner program would be cool too. Like 2 free tacos after 10 meals, I mean who cares taco cost is cheap and it promotes repeat biz. You have to cater to the direct neighborhood as well as trying to get tourists up this far. 30 years in the business here....man I wish I could run that place for a month! One can dream...
author: Scarlet M.

description: Came here for lunch on a weekday and loved everything I tried! The ambiance is fun with South American art pieces. I tried their eggplant tacos, shrimp tacos and the flower basket. All three were fantastically delicious. Sweet people to sweeten the deal.
author: Jake M.

description: Jackfruit tacos, homemade coconut horchata, delicious sides and plantain chimichangas for dessert?! Couldn't have wished for a better place to open up close to home! Also Michelle who runs the restaurant is super sweet!
author: Fsa A.

description: Came in for a quick bite. Awesome tacos. Had the shrimp and it was delish. Great friendly service as well. I'II def be back.
author: Christian M.

description: THIS PLACE IS EPIC. The food is out-of-this-world amazing--especially the jackfruit tacos, which are gorgeous gifts from God herself. Read: INCREDIBLE vegan options. Plus, the staff are welcoming and kind, and the venue is innovative and awesome. GO TO CHISME. It will change your life!
author: Sophia H.

description: I tried the chicken tacos... it was okay but it has potential to be so much better. I loved the chicken meat, seasoned and cooked well. However, it lacked condiments. I needed some hot sauce and salsa verde but also more cilantro, more lime and less cheese. I personally love sour cream on a taco so that was great. I will give them another try as I'd like to try other items on the menu. A salsa bar is just the thing they need!
author: Tahmeena A.

description: We came here a couple months ago for my husband's bday and it was so satisfying! Great for us, being plant-based, and great for the kids and meeting their needs!
author: Emily H.

description: Love Love love the jackfruit tacos! And the via via is great too. Being a vegan, this place offers great fresh food options that taste great. I definitely recommend giving it a try.
author: Lauren H.

description: Easily the best tacos in 94109 if not farther. The peanut mole is perfect. Can't pick a favorite between the steak, shrimp and chicken tacos. Great local beer on tap. Owner is kind.
author: Brooke M.

description: Good food, but for a taco restaurant?$17.95 for two tacos.... added a glass of wine and it was served in a plastic cup? Seriously? I'll go to the taco truck next time. Food was good but not worthy of the price
author: E L.

description: Cool vibe and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. I got the cauliflower ceviche which was honestly kind of bland. I wouldn't get it again. The tacos I ordered however were AMAZING!
author: Stephany D.

description: This little spot just opened across the street from us. My boyfriend eats there almost daily! The tacos are a little pricy but they are big and just the two and a salad or a side can really fill you up. My fav are the shrimp and the chicken tacos. The horchata was out of this world and they always have a new water infused with spinach or light fruits.
author: Lauren B.

description: Our group of 6 visited Chisme for dinner and loved it! Shrimp tacos were awesome - flavorful, the right amount of spice, filling, and beautifully presented with a flower. My husband had steak tacos and also really liked them. We ordered chips and guacamole (with pomegranate seeds on top - great idea), cauliflower ceviche, and mashed potatoes as sides. The ceviche was good, but I would prefer it made the original way with fish or shellfish instead of cauliflower. Mashed potatoes were delicious. We tried both red and white sangria, both excellent. We were excited to find this new restaurant!
author: Meg H.

description: Hostess was amazing. Food was delicious. Feeling full and happy. Will definitely come back.
author: Elle E.

description: The food and the service was amazing! Will come back for sure! Had the chicken tacos and shared some papas rojas. Next time I'll try the plantain tacos.
author: Juan D.

description:
I came here twice during the soft opening. So far the menu consists of 6 kinds of tacos, sides, and one dessert. They have a small selection of bottled beer and 3 on tap which are served in disposable plastic cups. The tacos and the sides are also served on disposable containers, so the place has a cafeteria/food truck kind of feel. I was pleasantly surprised to see that half of the taco choices are vegan and they're priced lower than the meat options. $8.25 for two veg tacos (two of the same kind, no mixing) seems reasonable, or at least no worse than anywhere else. And they were good enough that I probably would eat them again. However, most of the side items and some of the drinks are ridiculously overpriced. I tried the $8 pinchelotes which are two cuts of seasoned corn on skewers. The total amount is smaller than one ear of corn. It tasted okay but that would be an outrageous price for one ear of corn in any restaurant. The rest of the side items are similarly small and overpriced. There's more ridiculousness happening on the drinks menu. $7 for agua fresca?? That's for one plastic cup, not a pitcher. And $6 for horchata. And you can see the $9 dessert in the photos. There is no salsa bar but if you ask for it, you'll receive salsa verde.

I might come back for tacos but I'm staying the hell away from everything else on the menu.
author: keith s.

description: The food was great! I was waiting for a tapas place to open up around here. The staff is nice and the atmosphere is very warming/inviting. My new favorite tacos place!
author: Rachel Y.

description: Ate there today while in the neighborhood visiting family. We live across town in the mission so we rarely cross Market.. However, I'm gonna come back, with friends! The Mole sauce was so delicious I had a hard time not licking the paper my taco was served on. The salad was also simple, yet unique, and having the option to add meat on top of it would be ideal (sorry vegans). Also, since I often judge a cantina by the quality of it's chips, I say AMEN to this place+ they give you more chips until you can't chip anymore. The Tacos have thicker tortillas and are truly filling! I ordered a few different ones like I have at other places near me because I'm use to the small bites nature of most tacos- nope! Could barely eat my second one because I was so full! Keep that in mind when looking at the price! Like others have said, the "salsa" is spicy! Amazing, but spicy, especially for the ill prepared. Prepare yourself.
author: Elle M.
